com.nttdocomo.ui
Class VisualPresenter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Component
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.VisualPresenter
All Implemented Interfaces:
MediaPresenter
public class VisualPresenter
extends Component
implements MediaPresenter

This defines the playing objects of displayable media data. The media playing component class is a high level API component for playing the media data to be displayed on the screen. The display status can be notified by registering listeners.

When media data that cannot be played by UEs is set, the behavior is implementation dependent. An UIException is generated in some implementations.
The setAttribute method is used to set attributes. IMAGE_XPOS and IMAGE_YPOS attributes can be used to designate the location where the image is to be displayed. The image will be displayed in the manner that the part of the image designated by IMAGE_XPOS and IMAGE_YPOS is in the upper left corner of the presenter. In the application program, the image can have a scrolled display by changing this value. 

               IMAGE_XPOS
             +---+--------------+
             |                  |<- Image (MediaImage)
  IMAGE_YPOS +   +------------+ |
             |   | Visual     | |
             |   | Presenter  | |
             |   |            | |
             |   +------------+ |
             |                  |
             +------------------+
The setData method and setImage method are used exclusively for one presenter object. Image data cannot be set with the setImage method after data is set with setData method and vice versa. When the same method is called several times, only the data set last is valid.

Minimum Specifications In the minimum specifications, UnsupportedOperationException is generated with the setData method is called.

Listener does not activate in the minimum specifications.

When an application is suspended during the playing of animation, the playing is suspended temporarily and restarted after resumption of the application.

See Also:
AudioPresenter

Method Detail

setData

public void setData(MediaData data)
Sets media data.
This may not be supported depending on the UE.

Specified by:
setData in interface MediaPresenter
Parameters:
data - Designates media data.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - Generated when the UE does not support this method.
UIException - Generated when this method is called during playing (ILLEGAL_STATE).
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument data.
UIException - Generated when a media image that cannot be played by terminals is designated for the argument data (UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT).

setImage

public void setImage(MediaImage mediaImage)
Sets a media image.

Throws:
UIException - Generated when this method is called during playing or when the "use" method has not been called for the image which is set (ILLEGAL_STATE).
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument image.
UIException - Generated when a media image that cannot be played by UEs is designated for the argument image (UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT).

getMediaResource

public MediaResource getMediaResource()
This obtains the currently set resource.

Specified by:
getMediaResource in interface MediaPresenter
Returns:
The media resource.

play

public void play()
This starts playing the media data. It automatically stops when the data has played through to the end. When the play method is called before the presenter is actually displayed, playing of the media data actually starts after the presenter is actually displayed. When play method is called while playing, playing is stopped and restarted from the beginning.

Specified by:
play in interface MediaPresenter
Throws:
UIException - Generated when media data is not set or when media data is not playable (ILLEGAL_STATE).
UIException - Generated when the resources for audio presentation cannot be secured (NO_RESOURCES or BUSY_RESOURCE).

stop

public void stop()
This stops the playing of the media data. When the stop method is called while actually stopped, nothing occurs.

Specified by:
stop in interface MediaPresenter
Throws:
UIException - Generated when media data is not set (ILLEGAL_STATE).

setMediaListener

public void setMediaListener(MediaListener listener)
This registers listeners. Only one listener can be registered with the presenter. When this method is called several times, only the listener registered last is valid. When null is designated as a listener object, the listener registration is deleted.

Specified by:
setMediaListener in interface MediaPresenter
Parameters:
listener - Designates the listener to be registered.
